summary: Build a fun interactive browser-based hacking-style game website with multiplayer features, enhancing gameplay to feel more like a real hacking tool with richer interactive typing-based mechanics (not just a basic terminal).
architectural_notes: Frontend expects backend actor to provide a startMatch method; backend Candid/interface must stay in sync with frontend calls to avoid initialization failures.

Support Google Search Console verification on the static frontend by adding either (a) the provided verification HTML file at the site root or (b) the verification meta tag in the document <head>, depending on hosting constraints.

Deployment/runtime dependency: backend canister must be running (not stopped) for frontend calls like createLobby/startMatch to succeed; stopped canister yields IC0508 reject code 5 and surfaces as INITIALIZATION_FAILED.
known_issues: Solo mode fails to load/stuck on "initializing_solo_mode".
Solo mode initialization fails with "INITIALIZATION_FAILED" and RTS error "blob_of_principal: invalid principal" (invalid principal handling).
Solo mode fails with INITIALIZATION_FAILED because backend actor does not have a startMatch method available (API/interface mismatch).
Production/Solo initialization can fail with INITIALIZATION_FAILED when backend canister is stopped; createLobby call is rejected with IC0508 (reject code 5) "Canister <id> is stopped".
Regression observed: Solo mode stuck again on "INITIALIZING_SOLO_MODE..." (not loading).
Multiplayer mode not connecting (users unable to connect/join multiplayer session/lobby).
Post-deploy (v12): Solo mode still not loading; user reports persistent "INITIALIZATION_FAILED" on /solo.
Post-deploy (v13): Solo mode still shows "INITIALIZATION_FAILED" when attempting to launch Solo Mode.
Solo mode initializes but loads very slowly (performance issue on /solo startup).

existing_features.title: Create the core gameplay for a fun, simulated “hacking” browser game with short, replayable terminal-style challenges (e.g., scanning, decoding, command puzzles) that can be played in solo mode.

Add multiplayer support using Internet Computer canister state: users can create/join/leave lobbies, choose a game mode (competitive or cooperative), and play the same challenge round with shared state.

Implement a simple match loop and scoring system suitable for multiplayer: timed rounds, per-round scoring, and match completion with a results screen (winner for competitive; team score for cooperative).
Add a lightweight leaderboard/history view that shows recent matches and/or top scores stored in the canister (no external database).
Create a coherent, fun visual theme for the app (colors, typography, layout) that fits a playful “retro terminal / cyber arcade” aesthetic and apply it consistently across pages and game screens.
Add required static generated images to the frontend and use them in the UI (served from frontend/public/assets/generated) without routing through the backend.

Fix Solo Mode initialization so that navigating to /solo reliably creates a solo lobby, starts a match, and loads the first challenge instead of getting stuck on the "INITIALIZING_SOLO_MODE..." loading screen.

Frontend: Make SoloGamePage initialization robust by waiting for the backend actor to be available before calling createLobby/startMatch, and by displaying an error + retry/back controls if initialization fails (instead of only logging to console).
Frontend: Fix SoloGamePage result navigation to avoid using a stale score value when submitting a correct solution (ensure the score passed to /results matches the displayed score).

Add an interactive, command-driven terminal gameplay loop (not single “submit solution” only) where each entered command is parsed and responded to with realistic simulated tool output, and where challenges are solved through multi-step actions.

Frontend: Upgrade the terminal UI so it behaves like a tool-like shell: command history (arrow up/down), tab-completion or command suggestions, clearer prompt/context (e.g., current path/target), and streaming-style output rendering from the backend command responses.
Add a new "Updates" (changelog) page that lists recent game changes in clear English and is accessible via primary navigation (header) so players can see what was updated.
Make the displayed game version consistent across the UI by defining a single frontend version constant and using it wherever the version is shown (including the Home page hero subtitle).

Update the frontend `useStartMatch` hook to call the typed backend `startMatch` method directly (remove the `any` type assertion and the manual "method not available" guard) once the backend API is available, and ensure any remaining start-match failures surface as clear errors in the existing Solo initialization error UI.

Add Google Search Console ownership verification by serving the provided HTML verification file at the site root: create a static file named `google79d2180f87c8c2c7.html` whose contents are exactly `google-site-verification: google79d2180f87c8c2c7.html`, and ensure it is accessible at `https://<site-domain>/google79d2180f87c8c2c7.html`.

Add a shared frontend error-parsing utility that converts common Internet Computer canister/agent errors into clear, user-friendly English messages, including a dedicated case for the IC rejection error when the backend canister is stopped (e.g., reject_code 5 / error_code IC0508 / message contains "Canister <id> is stopped").

Update SoloGamePage to use the shared error-parsing utility and to display an actionable INITIALIZATION_FAILED state when createLobby/startMatch fails because the backend canister is stopped, including keeping the existing Retry and Back to Menu controls.

Replace alert-based error handling on HomePage multiplayer lobby creation with an in-page styled error message (terminal-themed) using the shared error-parsing utility, so users get consistent and readable errors (including stopped-canister errors).

Update LobbyPage (and MatchPage where applicable) to use the shared error-parsing utility for startMatch/leaveLobby/processCommand failures and show a consistent, user-visible error panel when these operations fail (instead of only console logging or generic messages).
Fix Solo Mode initialization so the /solo page cannot get stuck on the "INITIALIZING_SOLO_MODE..." loading screen after creating a solo lobby and calling startMatch.

Make SoloGamePage initialization resilient to React Query/state timing by ensuring the post-startMatch lobby refresh is performed against the correct lobbyId and continues until currentChallenge is present (or fails with a visible error).

Fix SoloGamePage initialization and rendering to correctly detect when `LobbyView.currentChallenge` is present by handling the Internet Computer Candid optional encoding (e.g., `[] | [Challenge]`) instead of relying on JavaScript truthiness of arrays.
Update MatchPage to unwrap and validate `lobby.currentChallenge` before rendering TerminalPanel, consistent with the Candid optional encoding used by the generated backend types.

Add a small shared frontend helper for unwrapping Candid optionals (e.g., `[] | [T] -> T | null`) and use it anywhere the UI reads `LobbyView.currentChallenge` to avoid repeating incorrect truthiness checks.

Audit and harden Solo Mode end-to-end (create lobby → start match → load first challenge) to eliminate any remaining cases where the user gets stuck on the "INITIALIZING_SOLO_MODE..." screen, including when backend calls fail or return incomplete lobby state.

Update the frontend `useProcessCommand` hook to call the typed backend `processCommand` method directly (remove the `any`-based method detection and the local simulation fallback), and ensure command-processing failures surface as clear, user-visible English errors in both SoloGamePage and MatchPage terminal output.

Ensure that navigating to a multiplayer lobby page (/lobby/$lobbyId) actually connects the current authenticated user to that lobby by performing a join flow when needed (instead of only polling getLobby).
Add an explicit “Join lobby”/retry affordance on LobbyPage for multiplayer lobbies so users who fail to connect can manually retry joining, with clear user-facing guidance when login is required.

Prevent multiplayer matches from failing due to missing lobby membership by ensuring MatchPage attempts to join the lobby (for cooperative/competitive) before allowing terminal command processing, and shows a clear error state if the user cannot join.

Diagnose and fix the Solo Mode initialization failure so that navigating to `/solo` reliably completes the flow `createLobby(#solo) -> startMatch(lobbyId) -> getLobby(lobbyId)` and reaches the playable terminal view without showing `INITIALIZATION_FAILED` for a healthy running canister.

Harden frontend error parsing for Solo initialization so `parseIcErrorToMessage` produces clear English messages not only for `Error` instances but also for common Internet Computer agent error object shapes (e.g., rejection objects containing fields like `reject_code`, `error_code`, and/or `message`), and ensure SoloGamePage always displays a non-empty message in the `INITIALIZATION_FAILED` panel.

Diagnose and fix the Solo Mode initialization flow so that navigating to `/solo` reliably reaches the playable terminal view for a healthy, running backend canister (i.e., `createLobby(#solo) -> startMatch(lobbyId) -> getLobby(lobbyId)` results in a lobby with `isActive = true` and a non-null `currentChallenge`, without entering the `INITIALIZATION_FAILED` UI state).

Improve the Solo initialization error panel so it always shows an actionable, specific English error reason produced by `parseIcErrorToMessage`, including when the backend canister is stopped, and ensure the displayed reason is visually prominent (not easy to miss) so users understand why `INITIALIZATION_FAILED` occurred.

Reduce Solo Mode initialization latency by eliminating the extra post-startMatch polling loop when possible: update the Solo initialization flow to reach a ready playable terminal view with fewer backend round-trips and without waiting up to the current MAX_POLL_ATTEMPTS × POLL_DELAY_MS window.

Update the frontend SoloGamePage initialization to use the new backend start-and-fetch API and immediately hydrate the React Query cache for ['lobby', lobbyId] from the returned lobby data, so the UI can transition to the ready state without an additional getLobby call or polling in the common case.

Update SoloGamePage initialization so it does not surface the error message “The game server may be slow or experiencing issues” prematurely during normal-but-slower Solo startup; instead, keep the user in a loading state with clear progress messaging and only fail after a longer, explicit timeout with Retry/Back controls.

Optimize SoloGamePage’s readiness polling/backoff behavior to reduce perceived latency while remaining resilient: prefer using the lobby returned by startMatchAndGetLobby immediately when it is already active and has a non-null currentChallenge; otherwise, perform a bounded retry strategy that prioritizes fast success but tolerates transient delays without failing early.

Fix Solo startup fast-path by correctly unwrapping Candid optional return values for `startMatchAndGetLobby` and `getLobby`, so the frontend does not mis-detect readiness and fall back into unnecessary polling.

Reduce Solo initialization latency by hydrating the React Query cache for the created lobby immediately from the `startMatchAndGetLobby` result, avoiding extra `getLobby` round-trips in the common case.

Reduce perceived and actual Solo startup latency by tightening the Solo readiness fallback path so the UI reaches the playable terminal state with fewer delays when `startMatchAndGetLobby` returns a lobby that is not yet ready (active + non-null currentChallenge). This includes tuning the bounded retry/backoff delays used by Solo readiness polling to favor faster early retries while remaining within the overall Solo init timeout.

Improve the Solo initialization loading UX messaging so progress feels more responsive during slower startups: display phase-specific English progress text and include elapsed time during `INITIALIZING_SOLO_MODE` to reassure users the game is still working while polling for readiness.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a fun browser-based hacking game website with multiplayer (real-time compete/collaborate).
Backend: Allow anonymous callers to play Solo Mode without requiring AccessControl #user permission, while keeping existing permission requirements for multiplayer modes (competitive/cooperative).

Fix backend Solo lobby creation to avoid trapping with an invalid principal string (RTS error: "blob_of_principal: invalid principal") by removing the use of `Principal.fromText("anonymous")` in `createSoloLobby` and using a valid `Principal` value instead.
Ensure Solo lobby data is internally consistent after creation (host and players) so subsequent operations that rely on membership/host checks do not fail unexpectedly for Solo Mode.
Improve gameplay to feel more like a real hacking tool (more engaging interactive typing-based mechanics and less "boring" terminal/code-only experience) to increase player fun and retention.

Backend: Implement per-lobby “terminal session” state and a command-processing API that takes (lobbyId, commandText) and returns structured terminal output plus updated session/challenge progress; ensure access rules remain consistent with current solo vs multiplayer authorization behavior.

Backend: Expand the challenge model to support multi-step, tool-like simulations (e.g., scanning/enumeration, file discovery, decoding) with a small set of simulated commands (e.g., help, clear, ls, cat, cd, scan, decode, grep) and realistic outputs; update the existing challenges to use this new structure.
Fix backend to expose/implement the startMatch method expected by the frontend (resolve Solo mode INITIALIZATION_FAILED due to "startMatch method not available in backend").

Implement a public backend method `startMatch(lobbyId)` that is exposed via the canister Candid interface so the frontend no longer fails with the error "startMatch method not available in backend" during Solo Mode initialization.

Define and enforce backend start-match rules: `startMatch(lobbyId)` must (1) validate the lobby exists, (2) validate the caller is authorized to start the match (host-only), and (3) transition the lobby to an active match state by setting `isActive = true` and assigning a non-null `currentChallenge` so the UI can render the Terminal challenge.

Add Google Search Console verification support for the deployed site (place the provided google-site-verification HTML file or equivalent meta-tag) so the game can be verified and indexed by Google Search.

Implement a real backend command-processing API for the terminal so the frontend no longer relies on the development-only simulation fallback in `useProcessCommand`; the backend API must accept `(lobbyId, commandText)` and return structured terminal output (`lines`, `solved`, optional `context`) compatible with the current `TerminalPanel` expectations.

Verify and fix backend Solo Mode authorization and identity handling so anonymous/unauthed users can play Solo Mode without triggering traps (including invalid principal handling), while keeping existing permission requirements for cooperative/competitive multiplayer actions.

Add backend-side safeguards so Solo Mode cannot fail due to inconsistent lobby state: after `createLobby(#solo)`, the lobby must have `host` set to the caller principal and `players` containing the caller principal; after `startMatch(lobbyId)`, the lobby must have `isActive = true` and `currentChallenge` set to a non-null challenge value.

Harden backend Solo lobby invariants and authorization so that Solo mode cannot fail due to inconsistent lobby state: after `createLobby(#solo)`, the lobby `host` must equal the caller principal and `players` must contain the caller principal; `startMatch(lobbyId)` must enforce host-only start and must not depend on any `#user` permission checks for Solo mode.
Improve Solo Mode initialization performance to reduce slow loading time (speed up /solo startup).

Add a backend API that allows the frontend to start a Solo match and immediately obtain the updated lobby state needed to render the first challenge, so the frontend does not need to separately call getLobby and then poll for currentChallenge/isActive. Keep the existing startMatch(lobbyId) behavior for compatibility, and add a new public method (e.g., startMatchAndGetLobby) that returns the post-transition LobbyView (or equivalent) including isActive=true and currentChallenge non-null.

Make backend startMatchAndGetLobby more retry-friendly for Solo performance by avoiding unnecessary traps when the match is already active: if the lobby is already active and has a currentChallenge, return the current LobbyView instead of trapping with “Match is already active”.

Ensure the backend `startMatchAndGetLobby(lobbyId)` always returns a lobby state that is immediately renderable (active + non-null challenge) on first call, and never returns `null` for an existing lobby that the caller is authorized to start.
